forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 56. West southwest wind 6 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
Amidst the tapestry of this evening, Downtown San Francisco finds itself cloaked in a veil of mostly cloudy skies, promising a low that hovers around the mild 56 degrees. The gentle breeze from the west southwest dances at speeds of 6 to 14 mph, occasionally rising to flirt with gusts of up to 18 mph, brushing past the iconic structures and winding streets, coaxing the shadows into playful movement.

As dawn breaks tomorrow, the city will awaken to partly sunny skies, with a high that rises to about 64 degrees, quietly fading to around 62 in the afternoon. The west southwest winds will continue their serenade, whispering through the neighborhoods at 5 to 14 mph and possibly reaching 21 mph in brief flurries. The marine layer, subtle yet persistent, will linger, casting a soft haze over the expanses of ocean and bay, dimming the brilliance of the sun’s descent. 

Tonight, as the cool air wraps around you, a light jacket will suffice, offering a comforting embrace against any lingering chill. Should you wish for a moment of solace, consider a stroll along the waterfront, where the rhythmic pulse of the waves meets the gentle hum of the city—ideal for quiet reflection or shared conversation. Be it sipping a warm drink at a local cafe or wandering through the tranquil streets, the evening beckons with whispers of serenity under the soft glow of city lights, creating an inviting ambiance for all who venture out.
